intro: Crotalaria glauca var. elliotii, commonly known as Elliot's false false flax, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, pinnately compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets. Its flowers are showy, with yellow petals and a distinctive spurred structure at the base. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some areas.
